clinical_study.official_title: Fyn Kinase Inhibitors and Alcohol Drinking

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of the study medication, saracatinib/AZD0530 (placebo or 125 mg/day) on alcohol drinking behavior in a laboratory setting in which participants are given an initial drink of alcohol followed by the choice to drink up to 12 more drinks over a three-hour period. The investigators hypothesize that saracatinib will reduce craving and number of drinks consumed prior to and after exposure to the initial drink of alcohol and during the three hour drinking period.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Drinks Consumed on Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Number of drinks consumed on Day 8

Craving for alcohol based on Yale Craving Scale, scores ranging from 0-112 mm on a visual analog scale, with higher measurements indicating higher craving. The baseline-adjusted craving is change score from baseline at Day 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stimulation and Sedation Responses to Alcohol (BAES)
secondary_outcome.description: Biphasic Alcohol Effects Scale scores will be used to assess stimulation and sedation

arm_group.description: Participants will take 125 mg of saracatinib daily for 8 days.
Participants will take placebo daily for 8 days.

intervention.description: Saracatinib 125 mg once per day for 8 days
Placebo once per day for 8 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 21-50
- Able to read English at 6th grade level or higher and to complete study evaluations
- Regular alcohol drinker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are seeking alcohol treatment
- Medical conditions that would contraindicate the use of saracatinib
- Regular use of other substances
